page.title: 14HOUSES IN BUCKNALL
page.content:
Most of the houses are built in {brick}(59). Other materials used for the walls are{breezeblock}(2) and {concrete}(2). 17 houses are {pebbledashed,}so we could not tell the exact construction of the walls. One house is built of{bricks, wood, and is {pebbledashed}too.
Most houses are{detached}(57). 27 are {semidetached,}and 4 are{mid-terrace houses. 4 buildings - the village hall, the school, the church, and the garage are not counted in the above numbers.
The buildings are in three areas of Bucknall, with at least one field separating each area. The areas are: Platts Lane/Chestnut Avenue; near the school; Copper Street/Horncastle Road.
